inn1.comm: lovely bouncer to start off with. Actually it is called a wide for height. Don't think it was wide, though. Went head-high, in front of his eyes. Tharanga played well by swaying out of its line and dropping his wrists. A harsh call on the wide
short of a length, on off, defended
shortish again, on the pads, tucked away for one
short, rib high, 134ks. Meat and drink for Jayawardene. He waits for it, gets inside the line, and taps it fine of fine leg
stays short of a length, 136ks, angling in, drops it at his toes and takes a single
fuller, on off, pushed to mid-off
length ball, on the pads, clipped to midwicket
short of a length, outside off, seams away, called wide
short of a length, outside off, left alone
yorker now, middle and leg, kept out well
good bounce... short of a length, outside off, moves away, left alone
more bounce for him. Head high for Charles. This is merely short of a length. And the ball holds its line too. Left alone by Jayawardene
fuller now, the sucker ball, just outside off, well done by Jayawardene to leave it alone. Chest high for Charles
what a beauty. That's a big outswinger. Starts on middle and off, and is full, so Jayawardene has to play at it. Beats the outside edge. Jayawardene is squared up. The crowd applauds it
tucked away off the hip for one
full, angling in, pushed wide of mid-on for one
Tharanga is very good at the cut. Short again, not too wide, but Tharanga creates his own room by the eventual flick of the wrists. Goes over point
length ball, angling away, left alone

dropped by Charles. What is Ramdin thinking now? What is the management thinking now? Length ball outside off, Tharanga drives at it, gets a thick edge, but Charles' weight is on his right foot, and he is late to move to his left. What a miss for West Indies
short of a length, on the stumps, defended
short, into the ribs, kept down... but he has overstepped
free hit is short too, and Tharanga wants to back away and swing, but he pulls over the ball. Beaten
fuller ball, crisply push-driven to mid-off where Best allows them a single
leading edge. Full, really full, he is looking to work to leg from leg-stump line, but the ball swings and takes the edge that lobs back over Holder's head
wide down the leg side
on a length, just outside off, pushed to cover
the bat has been pulled out of his hands. Short of a length, pitches on off, moves back in, Tharanga wants to defend, but the ball hits the shoulder of the bat, and it bursts out of Tharanga's hands
good catch from li'l Bravo. Charles sighs in relief. Full and wide, Tharanga drives, fails to keep it down, and Bravo lunges to his right to claim this at cover. Holder is pumped

the bouncer. That has sconed Jayawardene. Gibson and Dwayne Bravo have enjoyed it too. But they are checking it for a no-ball. What a sharp short ball. Chest high it comes, Jayawardene wants to pull, gets a thick top edge into the helmet, and the ball ricochets to point. The umpire asks Jayawardene to wait. Bravo and Gibson run back in to check on the telly. Roach's foot has landed just a centimetre behind the line and then slipped away. Touch and go, but fine as far as the no-ball is concerned

nearly three wickets in three balls for West Indies. This one seams back in and goes between bat and pad, but there is a loud click as the ball passes. Turns out it has gone off the pad. Umpire Llong is spot on
presses forward to push this wide of cover for one
short of a length, on off, defended off the back foot
fuller, on middle and off, Sangakkara is still on the back foot when he defends
short of a length, middle and leg, pushed into the on side for one
another no-ball from Holder. He has overstepped. Pitched up outside off, and wide too
This free hit is wide. Too short. Too high. Sanga tries to ramp it, but has missed. Charles is ordinary with the gloves, and parries this for four
this free hit is slower and full. Sanga makes room and drives. Best at mid-off is hit on the left knee, and allows them a single
length ball, on off, holds its line, defended
pitched up outside off, pushed in front of his body, straight to cover
short of a length, outside off, presses forward, covers the stumps, lets the ball go through to the keeper
short, wide, Chandimal throws his arms at it, and the extra bounce nearly carries it all the way to third man. Roach fields it on the bounce

and he is nearly lbw. Moves across to a full ball, misses it, and this is a close shout. The umpire reckons it is going down leg. The way Sanga set off for a run, though, you could see he was nervous. Replays show the ball is headed down leg
short of a length, hits high on Chandimal's defensive bat

top of off. Timbah. Beauty. Jaffa. Poor shot, though. Pushes forward to a length ball and drives away from the body. The ball jags back in, beats the inside edge, and goes through the gate to hit the top of off. Looking at the replays. Chandimal's first instinct was to go back, and then he pressed forward. Not full committed
dug in short, rising towards the chest. Thirimanne stands tall to defend
left alone outside off
short of a length, seams away, beats his defensive shot
pitched up this time, the sucker ball. Left alone
short of a length, angling in, hits the inside half of the bat. They take a sharp single to midwicket
length ball, outside off, he presses forward and defends
on a length, just outside off, defended back to him
flicked away off the pads for a single to long leg
short of a length, pitched outside leg, hits the high part of the bat and then through into his ribs
fuller now, Sanga is caught back, and the ball moves away to beat the outside edge
stays short of a length, but gets the ball to rise towards his shoulder. Well played by Lahiru, dropping his wrists at the last last moment
pitched up this time, but Thirimanne is equal to it, and drives it back to Roach
wide length ball, left alone
lovely square-drive, he leans into a length ball, and drives with a slightly open face. Darren Bravo makes a diving save at point, and keeps them down to one
short of a length, on off, angling away, defended off the back foot
short of a length, angling away, Sanga goes back and punches this to cover
short of a length, on the pads, clipped away past midwicket
short of a length, outside off, good bounce again. Left alone
full, on off, he goes for the drive, but the angle takes the ball away, and takes a thick edge to point
another thick edge. Not quite to the pitch of the ball he is driving at. The edge goes between point and cover-point
full, swinging into the pads, Sanga almost overbalances, but the bat comes down in time and clips this past square leg
short of a length, on off, defended off the back foot
length ball outside off, left alone to Charles
short of a length, middle and off, left alone again
bounce and seam movement. Short of a length, pitched outside leg, and then rises toward the chest. He fends at it, and is beaten
defended off the back foot
pitched up full, Thirimanne is equal to it. He is not caught back after the short barrage. Driven between the stumps and mid-off. Pollard gives excellent chase, and slides to keep it in
slightly short of a length, just outside off, holds its line. Sanga covers the stumps, and leaves it be
swinging yorker first up. Thirimanne does well to cover the line and keep it out
length ball, on off, defended back to him
length ball, outside off, left alone
what a beauty. Short of a length, on off, shaping up to swing back in, but after pitching it seams away. Too good. And he is beaten
pushed through wide outside off, and left alone
short of a length, outside off, punched to point. Sammy starts off with a maiden
length ball outside off, left alone
wide full toss, driven straight to cover
full outside off, dug out to point
short of a length, on off, angling away, left alone
length ball outside off, left alone
short of a length, on off, seams away. Left alone again
the ball is doing too much here. Length ball, on off, draws him forward, then seams away to beat the edge
extra bounce from short of a length, he rides the bounce, and cuts it past point for one
fuller now, pushed wide of mid-off for one
another unplayable delivery. It shapes up to swing inside, and then seams away after pitching. Beaten again
short of a length, on off, defended
wide length ball, seams away, is called
this one comes back in after pitching off. Defended to leg
heavy ball right away, hits him high on the cut
length ball, outside off, 143ks, seams away, called a wide, Charles is ordinary again, and lets away four more. You should get a part-time keeper only when desperate
short of a length, middle and leg, worked into the on side
short of a length, just outside off, defended with an open face
full, outside off, driven nicely, but straight to cover
short of a length, pitched outside leg, gets inside the line to work this to leg
extra bounce from short of a length and outside leg. Hits his thigh pad
extra bounce, spongy bounce. Thirimanne follows it outside off. Lucky to not edge it
full, outside off, holds its line. Left alone
short of a length, just outside off, seams away again to beat the outside edge. One of these days he will get an edge
fuller, outside off, this time left alone
just short of a length, just outside off, holds its line, then kicks off too. Left alone well, but collected in front of his face by Charles
this is a little too wide, and is left alone
length ball, holds its line in front off, runs off the inside half of the bat, past square leg
bouncer, head-high, pulled away nicely. Keeps it down
tucked away off the hip
bouncer, too high, called a wide
driven off the outside half, gets a single to deep point
short again, but wide down the leg side. That's 20 extra runs now
pitched up outside off, driven with an open face for a single to third man
yorker, 144ks, just outside off, Sanga gets across and keeps it out
short of a length, pitched outside leg, Thirmanne wants to drop and run, but has sent it too close to Sammy
length ball outside off, left alone this time
moves well across even before Sammy has let the ball go. Sammy bowls outside off, and Thirimanne finds midwicket with his flick
Sammy stays on target, and Thirimanne presses forward in defence
driven on the up, to deep cover for one
looks to cut, but the ball is not wide enough, and beats him
short, gets good bounce, down leg, but not called wide. That's strange. Nowhere near touching the body there
short of a length, outside off, played with an open face, gets a single to third man
stays short of a length, middle and off, defended off the back foot
good bouncer. Pitches leg, rises over the stumps, Sanga pulls out of the pull because of the rise
full, nearly a yorker, dug out to cover
short, on the leg line, Sanga wants to pull, mis-hits it into the ground. Lucky to not play it on
length ball, just outside off, Thirimanne presses forward in defence
short of a length, on off, angling away, defended off the front foot
looks to drive hard as Sammy pitches this fuller, hits the higher part of Thirimanne's bat
stays on a length, just outside off, defended to point
moves well across the stumps to bunt this shortish delivery into the on side. Uses the 7-2 field to get a single
bouncer, head high, Sanga gets inside the line to pull this to long leg. Keeps it down
seam movement from just outside off. Beats the drive
short of a length, outside off, rocks back to punch this to third man
short of a length, rising towards the chest, Thirimanne moves across to defend
cut away to third man again
full and wide, just inside the tram line

Sammy nearly produces a wicket out of nowhere. Driven nicely on the up, and it has four written all over it until Sammy dives at cover and erases it. He hasn't time enough, though, to write run-out. He lets through a throw fast, but he has missed it by inches
left alone outside off
Sanga taking  the odd chance now. Dances down the wicket, takes this on a half-volley, and drills it past Sammy for four
short of a length, on the pads, defended to leg
stays short of a length, on middle and leg, defended again
pitched up, outside off, mis-hits the off-drive, but gets it straight of mid-off for a single
full, on off, and he has worked this into the open on-side field
Extras take the lead on the highest score again. Bouncer. Five wides. Once again, Charles could have stopped it, but he has let simpler ones go
punched away to third man
short of a length, pitched outside leg, flicked away square on the on side. Darren Bravo makes a sliding save at the boundary
full outside off, driven wide of mid-off for one
slower ball, 118ks, full, just outside off, defended off the front foot
slower ball again, short of a length, punched away to third man
length ball, pitches middle and off, and is defended just outside off
starts with a slow offbreak, defended to point
short of a length, punched away to deep cover
quicksih, but gets extra bounce. Is cut away well to deep cover
fuller, slower, draws the thick edge, but it doesn't carry to backward point
the quicker one, Thirimanne is late on it, but gets an inside edge onto the pad. No turn on it either
full and wide, asks him to drive, which Thirimanne does, but gets a thick edge that falls short of backward point
and resumes with a loose delivery. Short, slow, wide, and cut away for four. Sanga beats extras as the top scorer of the innings
fuller this time, gets a thick outside edge that goes between cover-point and point
on a length, just outside off, defended off the front foot
Thirimanne dances down the wicket to look for release. Throws his bat at a length ball, and it goes off the outside half of the bat for a couple over point
short of a length, just outside off, Thirimanne tries to slog it to leg - remember, 7-2 field for Thirimanne - and the extra bounce beats him
slower ball, just outside off, steered away to third man
short of a length, middle and off, punched to cover
length ball, on off, worked away into the leg side for a single
short of a length, nicely pushed away to deep cover
short of a length, gets some turn, pushed straight to short cover

and Samuels strikes early again. The quicker one without warning. Thirimanne is looking to work this shortish delivery to leg, but it hurries off, and hits the inside edge and bursts through into the stumps
quick offbreak, Mathews has come too far across, and it turns past to miss the leg stump by a bit. Still called a wide
full, on off, pushed to mid-on
short of a length, on off, defended to cover
Mathews nearly runs himself out. Punched to point, and Mathews sets off. Sanga has to send him back, and Mathews has to dive full length. The ball doesn't hit the stumps anyway
punched away to deep cover
length ball, just outside off, defended off the back foot
short of a length, on off, Mathews defends from deep inside the crease
stays short of a length, the ball stays low, and is defended towards mid-on
flighted, on the pads, clipped away to long-on
out of nowhere. Mathews has been defending, defending, defending, but suddenly he goes across and down on a knee to sweep this over square leg for a six
slower through the air, gets some bite too. Defended with the bottom hand off
length ball, turning in, defended to cover
quicker ball, hits the inside half of the bat
full, middle and leg, driven to long-off
short of a length, outside off, dabbed away for a single
tucked away off the hip for a another single
length ball, just outside off, driven down the ground, and Pollard makes a diving save at straightish short extra cover. One run saved
length ball, middle and leg, driven to mid-on
short of a length, just outside off, placed wide of cover for one
short of a length, just outside off, holds its line, squares him up a little in defence
short of a length, just outside off, pushed to long-off
quick and short, tucked away around the corner for another single
offbreak, starts outside leg, pushed in front of off, to the the straight short extra cover
fired in quick, down the leg side, but the umpire reckons it has kicked the thigh pad on the way
driven to long-off for one
short of a length, turning in, defended back to him
short of a length, pushed into the off side, Samuels from point hits the stumps at the non-striker's end, but Sanga is home
short, slow, tucked away into the on side
short of a length, just outside off, driven to extra cover
short of a length again, and Sanga finds that man at extra cover again
driven on the up, but gets just the single to deep point
goes wide of the crease to bowl a full slower ball, which also follows Mathews who is backing away. Gets just the single to deep midwicket
full, just outside off, beats the reverse sweep, draws an lbw appeal, but it has hit him outside the line
quicker, short, punched to long-off for one
offbreak, hits the thick outside edge, goes for a single to wide of cover
quicker shortish ball, Mathews wants to cut, gets a bottom edge that beats both the keeper and short third man
gets a leading edge as he looks to work this to leg. Gets a single to cover
full outside off, driven to deep cover for one
short of a length, just outside off, cut away to third man
extra bounce from that height. Short of a length, hits him at the top of the thigh pad. Mathews is surprised by the bounce
backs away to slog, gets a thick inside edge for one
short of a length, angling across, drops this at his toes and takes a single
bouncer, and Mathews is now blindly slogging away. Gets a bottom edge towards midwicket
full, and Mathews was ready this time, and not caught at the back foot. Clears the front leg, and lofts this over mid-off for four
short of a length, just outside off, punched to deep cover for one
shot. Mathews has picked this up beautifully. Length ball outside off, he plants the front foot down, and lofts this over long-on
quick and full, Mathews drives, hits Sanga's pad at the non-striker's. Still gets the single, which they would have anyway
driven to long-on for another single
yorker. Quick, middle and leg, and it has to be dug out
another quick yorker, gets a single to long-on

and gone first ball. Mathews has taken one risk too many. Mathews backs away a long way, Roach follows him with a length ball. Mathews tries to go over cover/point, but doesn't get enough bat, and is caught at point
full, outside off, pushed to straight extra cover
sharp bouncer. This has shocked and jolted Mendis, although he gets four fr it. This hits the bat even before he realises, and flies over the keeper's head. Almost takes the bat along with it
length ball, accurate, pushed to mid-on
nicely played. Short of a length, angling away, punched away square, to the left of third man. Best from third man does well to reach the ball, but can't keep it in

Roach has four, Mendis doesn't like it. He is moving across, ends up moving too far. Roach bowls short of a length, and on the stumps. Mendis has already got inside the line, and the ball passes over the stumps as he jabs at it. Roach appeals for the catch, umpire Llong upholds the appeal. Mendis suggests he hasn't gloved it. Replays are not clear. He might have missed it here
bouncer, gets a little big, Sanga mis-hits the pull for a single to square leg
short again, he rides the bounce, and dabs it to third man
nicely played. Sanga is moving across, which makes Holder angle it a bit wide, but then he stops moving, and nicely opens the face on it to use Holder's pace and send it to third man for four
big wide outside off as Sanga tries to move away to leg
looks to drive a wide length ball, mis-hits it to mid-off to bring up a fighting half-century. He has played well in difficult conditions
backing away, Holder bounces him, takes the top edge, into the helmet grille, Kula's head falls back. Safe
in the slot. Short but without sting. Just waist high. And in Kula's swinging arc at middle and leg. And he sends it sailing over deep midwicket
flat, almost parallel six. Best starts short, not even chest high, and Sanga gets inside the line to swivel-pull it over long leg
short again, and no sting behind it. Takes this from outside off, and pulls this in front of square, and along the ground
short of a length, outside off, dabbed away to point
tries the wide yorker, but a little too wide. Called
slices this drive over point for a single
length ball, into the pads, clipped away to deep midwicket
full and straight, a single is the best he can do with this
full and straight, driven to long-off for one
full toss, middle and leg, driven to long-on
yorker, dug out to cover for a risky single. Pollard throws at the non-striker's end. Concedes four overthrows. He was gone had Pollard hit
full and straight, dug out for a single
dropped. Tough chance for Charles. Sanga backs away and drives, but this is a thick edge, and hits Charles's thumb with the deviation
lovely shot. Kula backs away and also gets under this full ball, and goes over cover for four
wide yorker to outdo Sanga who is backing away. Just the single
looks to shuffle across to try and beat short fine leg, but is hit on the pad by a wide yorker. Gets a leg-bye
slower ball, doesn't arrive. Sanga is trying to heave it over midwicket, but gets only the inside edge into the pad
no-ball. What a time for a no-ball. Wide full ball again, he moves across the line to flick this into the leg side
the free hit is a length ball, Sanga gets too much under it, and lofts it to long-off. The skier is so high they have time to take two run
length ball outside off, he moves across to scoop this over square leg. Just a chip
lucky for Sanga. Slower ball, outside off, Sanga is down the wicket, but still early into the shot, but the outside edge bisects the keeper and short third man

meanwhile Kula is gone. Holder follows the batsman who is backing away, and the little extra bounce means Kula has got too much under the ball and skied it. Bravo runs in from long-on, and to his left, and also calls for it, and avoids the converging fielder from long-off to take a safe catch
cramps him up with the angle on this shortish delivery. Sanga can take just the single
short of a length, extra bounce, hits him on the thigh pad, but can't prevent the leg-bye

slogged away with the angle, Devon Smith runs to his right from deep square leg, and keeps this in. The ball bounces just before the rope, has reached the air space beyond the rope, but Smith knocks it back in
slower ball, mis-hits it straight of long-off, and comes back for two
another lucky boundary. Sanga backs away and swings, and gets a thick edge to this length ball, which flies over short third man for four
slower ball, very wide, Senanayake still goes after it, and edges it over short third for two. would have been wide had he not touched it
slower bouncer, follows him too, and Senanayake gets no touch on the ball. Sanga at the other end is 89 not out
short, wide, cut away over point, to the right of third man, and Sanga steals a third. Wild throw from Bravo
short of a length, makes room to hit it to deep cover for one. No century for Sanga today then
goes wide of the crease, bowls length, Senanayake gets a thick edge to the right of third man. Bravo does well to keep the ball inside the rope
slower bouncer, Senanayake throws his bat it, gets another edge, and this time Bravo - wearing sunglasses, mind you - has enough time to come under it and catch it

inn2.comm: accurate start first up. Slight extra bounce, and Gayle defends this length ball with the bottom hand off the handle
again the ball stops a touch at Gayle and moves away a little. Gayle fends away wide of point for one. Lucky to not spoon it up in the air
length ball, just outside off, defended with an open face
too straight, lucky to get away with just the single as Charles has found long leg
short of a length, pitches middle and leg, hits the pad after seaming back in
short of a length, just outside off, punched away to cover
outswinger first up. On a length, can't drive at it without a big stride in. Charles pushes inside the line
short of a length, punched away to third man for one
full and wide, Gayle goes after it, but plays outside the line, and is beaten under the bat. Should have been called a wide
big wide down the leg side
movement back in. That's the outswinger Eranga is bowling well today. On a length, outside off, Gayle drives, but the ball moves back in to beat the inside edge
slashes, slashes hard. That's a safe shot. Wide length ball, and he goes hard at it, knowing the edge of the ball will clear slips easily. As it does
short of a length, just outside off, defended with an open face
lovely ball. This one shapes up to be an insiwnger, but seams away after pitching outside off. Charles withdraws at the last moment
shot. On a length, angling in, he clears the front leg and swipes this over midwicket. Off the inside half of the bat
fuller, middle and leg, pushed back, hits the stumps at the non-striker's end
length ball, into the pads, worked away for an easy single

return chance dropped. The ball stops at Gayle, he fails to keep the check shot down, it goes to the left of Kula, who goes at it with two hands, but the seam of the ball catches the knuckles, which has Kula in pain
full, middle and leg, defended. Gentle medium pace it was
shortish, angling away, beats Gayle's attempt at the cut
beaten on the cut again. The ball is seaming away, and Gayle is going hard at it. Chances are, if he gets an edge on this, it will clear the slips
full toss, just outside off, drilled through cover for four. Can't bowl that to Gayle
swing and miss. He just stands tall and tees off. The length ball bounces a touch extra and beats the bat
wide length ball. Not much follow-through of the bat, but the meeting of the bat and the ball is so crisp it goes flying over wide mid-off for four
length ball, driven to mid-off
length ball, angling in, worked into the leg side
pushed to mid-off for a single
length ball, outside off, swiped to midwicket

Mathews has struck. And it's that short third man that has taken the wicket. Short of a length, just outside off, he punches at it, gets s thick outside edge, and lobs it to the right of that short third man. Taken easily
short of a length, middle and off, defended off the back foot
length ball, outside off, left alone
full, into the pads, whipped away square of square leg, all along the ground

lovely return catch. Charles wants to pull one from just outside off, but he is a little late into the shot, and ends up almost toe-ending it back. The ball is falling at Eranga's toe. If he had been at Wimbledon, this had got too low to be an easy volley, but he takes it off his toes with both hands. Not short enough to be pulled
yorker first up, Samuels is on the crease and across the stumps. Does well to keep it out
wide length ball, left alone after moving across
wide short ball. The extra bounce means Samuels doesn't venture into a cut

Sri Lanka on fire. Lovely catch again. It's Jayawardene this time. Not a great shot. Short of a length, just outside off, with that extra bounce. Samuels plays a lazy back-foot drive. Had he gone hard, perhaps the edge would have cleared slip, but this one settles with Jayawardene high and to his left at first slip
length ball outside off, Smith tries to drive, is hit on the inside half of the bat
short of a length, outside off, hits the outside half of the bat, and goes to the fourth slip. We have a first and fourth slip here
fuller, on off, defended from the crease
length ball, outside off, angling away, left alone
this one seams back in, hits his pad, draws an lbw appeal, but is buncing too high
length ball outside off, pushed to mid-off
extra bounce again, but Bravo does well to keep it down, and gets a single behind square on the off side
stays back to a length ball, is hit on the pad, but the ball has pitched outside leg
short of a length, outside off, left alone
wide shortish delivery, left alone again
wide length ball, extra bounce, beats the drive
full outside leg, kisses the pad on the way through
short of a length, punched away to deep point for one

given lbw. Not sure if this is a good decision. The ball seamed back in, so that is one criterion fulfilled, but it seemed to be a little too high and a little too straight. Waiting for the replays to prove me wrong. And yes, the replays have proven me wrong. Short of a length, pitches leg, seams back to hold its line, hits him high on the pad, but would have hit the top of the stumps
short of a length, outside off, he stays inside the line
forward defensive to a length ball
dangerous batting. Stays back and moves across to a straight lenght ball, and is squared up in defence
this one holds its line outside off, and Simmons is beaten and squared up
length ball, on off, driven to mid-off on the up
short of a length, pitches off, angles away, left alone
short of a length, outside off, hits the toe end on the punch
short of a length, outside off, left alone
covers the angle of the ball, dabs it away to third man for a single
short of a length, outside off, punched away to cover-point
seams away, stays low, beats Bravo's bat who couldn't have done much besides pushing at the line
shortish, outside leg, tucked away to fine leg
wide length ball, left alone
length ball, angling in, Simmons moves across to push this to midwicket
short of a length, wide outside off, Simmons doesn't play at it
short of a length, angling in towards off, defended off the back foot
short to start off with, cut away, but can't beat cover-point
full, into the pads, worked into the on side for one
offbreak, starts well outside off, defended off the front foot
arm ball outside off, Simmons leaves it alone
offbreak now, defended in front of leg
flighted outside off, draws the loose drive, but the inside edge hits the pad
short of a length, cross-seam, extra bounce, beats the punch from Bravo
length ball outside off, left alone
another leave outside off
length ball, middle and off, defended back to him
short, wide, cut away to deep point
wide length ball, holds its line, beats the drive
the arm ball. Doesn't turn, and cramps him up
short offbreak, dabbed away for a single
looks to paddle-sweep this, but is beaten by the extra bounce. Zero not out off 14 now
bunts an offbreak into the leg side to get off the mark
full, middle and off, pushed with an open face past point
short of a length, outside off, doesn't turn as much as Simmons is expecting it to. Beaten
short of a length, outside off, punched to extra cover
short, wide, cut away, but can't beat backward point
slow wide half-volley, drilled to long-off for one
short of a length, wide, cut away to third man
wide half-volley, drilled to wide long-off again
wide half-volley again, driven to deep cover for a single
sharp offbreak, beats the inside edge, but Simmons has got the front pad outside the line of off
tossed up wide, defended off the front foot
another forward-defensive to cover
full, into the pads, worked wide of mid-on for one
flighted on middle and off, the drive down the ground can't beat the diving straight extra cover
into the pads, bunted away into the leg side for one
short of a length, outside off, defended with an open face
driven on the up, but can't beat that straight extra cover
short of a length, outside off, pushed away to deep cover for one
short of a length, holds its line outside off, Simmons is squared up and beaten
punched away to deep cover
length ball outside off, driven to deep cover for one
short of a length, no room, punched to deep cover
and Simmons breaks the boundary drought. Down the wicket, right to its pitch, and plays the pick-up over wide long-on. That's a trademark Simmons shot
full and fast, and he has swept this fine for a couple
length ball, turning in, Simmons defends off the front foot
tossed up outside off, defended with an open face
offbreak, on a length, defended with bat and pad close together
wide length ball, left alone
length ball, outside off, driven to short cover
short of a length, just outside off, defended off the back foot
short of a length, on off, punched to point
bouncer, outside off, head high, and he pulls out of the pull at the last moment as the ball keeps rising
this one swings back in, played to point. Maiden over
topspinner, defended from the back foot
tossed up outside off, defended to cover
sharp, down the leg side, would have been a wide had he not deflected it to short fine leg
punched away to deep cover
. Bravo wants to cut, but the ball doesn't turn and cramps him up. The edge goes low to Jayawardene's right at first slip. Can't even get a touch on it
bunted into the leg side for a single
length ball, on the pads, worked into the leg side for one
sharp, short, but just outside the line of leg stump. It had Simmons hopping
slower ball, low full tosses, worked away into the leg side
loose drive outside off, down the wrong line of a length ball, and is beaten on the inside edge
kicks at him from just short of a length, and Bravo plays well with soft hands and guides it to third man for one
hopping again, but keeps this down and takes a single to third man
bouncer, on off, Bravo ducks under it
down the wicket, beaten in the flight, kicks this away outside leg
dips on hi, turns back in, hits the inside half of the bat, goes away for a single
pitched up on the pads, worked away for a single
short of a length, turning in, defended off the back foot
flighted outside off, defended back to him
another forward-defensive
wide length ball, punched away to deep cover
five wides. Something West Indies desperately needed. Short of a length, into the body, but it seams away and avoids Sanga late
wide length ball, left alone
short of a length, outside off, pushed to third man for one
short of a length, wide, cut away to third man
accurate length ball, Simmons defends off the back foot
lovely delivery. Seams away against the angle after pitching a little short. Simmons has to play at it, and is beaten
length ball, driven straight to short cover
short, pitched outside leg, pulled away for a single
full, middle and leg, driven to long-on
pulled away, but not very well, and gets just the single to long-on
lovely shot. Knows mid-off is up, makes room, takes it on the half-volley, and goes inside-out over mid-off
short of a length, just outside off, dabbed away for a single
starts with a lengbreak, on a length, defended off the front foot
wide full toss, attempted googly, driven to deep cover
another full toss wasted. Swept fine, but Senanayake makes a diving save at short fine leg
lovely shot this time. A legbreak, on a length, but Bravo doesn't let it bounce. Down the track to take it on the full and smash it over midwicket for six
googly, pitched outside leg, hits the pad on the sweep
another googly. Bravo doesn't read it. So that's four googlies out of six. Bravo tries the big drive down the wicket, and is beaten
slower ball, on a length, defended back to him
short ball, into the body, pulled away to deep square, where Jayawardene makes a diving save. Surprised to see him in the deep
bouncer, on the stumps, he ducks under it
full, middle and off, moved away a little, hits the outside half of the bat and goes for a four fine of third man. Lucky there
slower ball, short of a length, middle and leg, worked with the offcut to get a single to point
slower ball again, bunted into the leg side, wants a single, but Malinga is quick to get to the ball
wide length ball, punched away nicely to deep point
short of a length, holds its line outside off, beats the outside edge
length ball, angling in, pushed to cover
full and straight, mis-hit to cover
gentle short ball, Simmons is waiting for it and rocks back to pull this over deep midwicket
short of a length, outside off, opens the face to get a single
beautiful shot. Malinga misses the yorker by half a foot, and he gets under to drive it over mid-off for four more
full again, driven wide of deep cover for a couple
bouncer, on the stumps, pretty sharp, and Bravo has to duck it
wide swinging away, Bravo tries to slice it to third man, but is beaten

swat-pull. This is the first bouncer Bravo has played. It comes from the top, and it is almost a hook. Wide of deep midwicket. This shot has brought the crowd back to life. They love the bouncers and the hooks. Gets three despite a good effort from Thirimanne
full, a yorker, for a moment it seems Malinga is going to get a dead plumb lbw, but Simmons gets the bat down in time, and takes a single too
ho ho ho. That's out of Trinidad. Simmons dances down the wicket, gets under a length ball, and drives this slower ball back over the bowler's head, and into the roof. Bye bye ball
regulation pace, shortish, outside off, the extra bounce beats the cut
nicely played. Third man is square. He waits for this shortish ball to come to him, and he opens the face to beat the third man. Top shot
this time he is beaten as this shortish ball holds its line outside off
length ball, into the pads, finds midwicket
short of a length, outside off, steered away to third man
full, driven hard, but straight back to Sena
short of a length, defended off the front foot
down the wicket, takes this on the full, gets a single to long-on
short, on the stumps, makes room to punch it to deep cover
Simmons is dealing in sixes. Not even fours. This is an incredible shot. Off the back foot, against the turn, inside-out. What a drive over long-off. What a smashing way to bring up the fifty
dipping full toss, driven to long-on for one
yorker, Simmons goes back to dig it out for a single to point
wide half-volley. Just misses the yorker. Not by much. Darren Bravo follows the line and drives along the ground and to the left of deep cover. Fifty for Li'l Bravo too
slower ball, full still, driven to long-off for one
yorker, middle and off, swinging in, dug out
lovely shot. This time the yorker comes out a little too full, and Simmons flicks this low full toss past short fine leg. How wrist is that
full and wide, steered away to third man
and Simmons tries a big drive and nearly finds extra cover on the full. On the half-volley
short, gets a little big on him, hits the high part of the bat on the pull
short of a length, outside leg, dabbed away to point for one

four. Back-foot cover-drive, inside-out, and over extra cover. Surely there hasn't been much there? Backs away, gets a shortish delivery, but goes ahead with the drive, and clears extra cover with ease
Eranga goes full and wide, and Simmons goes with an open face, past point, past third man, the crowd in a frenzy now

the crowd has been stunned into silence. Simmons goes for that six but finds deep cover. Gets a half-volley, on off, drives inside-out, wants to clear the cover field but doesn't get enough bat on it. What a crucial strike for SL. The par score now becomes 166
short of a length, into the body, tucked away to short fine leg
this one seams away from short of a length, and beats Pollard's outside edge
short of a length, outside off, rising, left alone

gone. What a beauty from Malinga. This is a special delivery. Short of a length, outside off, Pollard pushes at it away from the body, which moves and kicks away and takes the shoulder of the bat through to Sanga. Forget par scores now
Sammy too fumbles in the dark. Short of  length, outside off, beats him
and he finishes a wicket-maiden. Again it holds its line outside off, and beats the bat
looks to manufacture room to cut, beaten by the lack of room and extra bounce
jumps at him, beaten in the flight, pushes this wide of cover for one
full, turning in, defended back to him
looks to smash this, but it is not in his swinging arc, and gets a single off the inside half of the bat
cut away from in front of off. Nicely done to make room. Between point and cover-point. Gets a couple
quicker ball, into the pads, gets a bottom edge on the pull. Takes a single
slower ball, mid-off is up, and even though this short, Bravo has muscled this over mid-off for four
short, quick, gets the bottom edge on the pull, and into the ribs
short ball, stays a touch low and squeezes under the pull
cut uppishly, on two bounces to deep cover for one
length ball, gets a little big on him, mis-hit towards mid-on for one
short of a length, pitched outside leg, dabbed away to point for one
full and wide, squeezed past point for a couple
full, on off, driven hard into the ground, over the bowler's head for a single
Sammy swings, and is in a different postal code to a shortish ball well outside off
short of a length, smashed on the up and down the ground, but he can't beat mid-off
full toss wasted. Hit straight to mid-off for one
length ball, into the pads, hit hard behind square, and once again Sammy has found the fielder: the short fine leg this time
low full toss, hit straight to mid-on. Not even a single
full toss, muscled away, gets just the single. Bravo has lost his timing over the last two overs
short of a length, Sammy still goes for the bog drive, the ball bounces and hits the sticker on the bat, and Malinga ends up skying it. Malinga runs towards midwicke to claim the catch
wide full toss, driven wide of deep cover for a couple
yorker, on off, dug out for a single
length ball, swings away, beats the outside edge
wide length ball. Pre-empting an away movement from Bravo. Goes too wide. Called too
short ball, stays low to beat the pull. Bravo is lucky it isn't straight

and this is done now. Bravo is frustrated and is teeing up for big hits every ball. Loses his shape as he slogs at this, and ends up slicing this shortish delivery to long-off. SL still in with a shout for a bonus point
Roach smashes a short ball to long-on for one
slower ball, on target, and hits top of off. Offcutter from outside off, Holder tries to drive, plays down the wrong line, and is castled. Mathews is chuffed, and why wouldn't he be?
length ball, angling in, hits the inside edge onto the pad
a solid defensive off the front foot
slower ball, full, hits the inside half of the bat. Gets a single
that lethal dipping full toss. Best has no clue about it. He is ducking a beamer here, but it comes down and hits the calf. Only it is headed down leg
tries that dipping full bunger again, but this is a wide down leg
yorker, on off, dug out by Best
slower ball, half-volley outside off, pushed to cover
shot. Slower ball, another half-volley, Best fancies it and drives it over mid-off for for four
bouncer now, on the stumps, he ducks under it
legbreak, on a length, middle and leg, defended
short of a length, middle and leg, punched away to midwicket
oh boy. Altercation between Best and Mendis. Pushed to the right of the bowler, Mendis runs into Best and jokingly tries to hold onto him. Best gives him a piece of his mind
bunted into the leg side for one. No bonus point now
beaten on the cut
Best is down the track, and is beaten. Sanga misses the stumping
Roach slogs a length ball, and gets four wide of midwicket
defended back
short this time, pulled away for a single
slightly down the wicket, defends
shimmies and defends
pushed outside off, beats the cut
